Fixed #1683.
But not complete(maybe the remaining issue is specific to the Japanese IME).

data.title: added FileHandle#listFiles(FilenameFilter)
data.body: Not sure why it was not yet implemented. Would such a method be welcome?

data.title: Various changes, mostly remove Vector3#tmp
data.body:
Various changes:
- Remove Vector3.tmp/tmp2/tmp3 and Vector3#tmp()/tmp2()/tmp3()
- Update the tests accordingly
- Fix #1678 (intersectRayBoundsFast) by removing the division by zero check
- Add Vector#isOnLine which checks collinear regardsless direction
- Fix #1657 vectors dont have to be normalized anymore to check for collinear

Please note that this is an API breaking change (although the tmp vectors are deprecated for quite some time now) and will break the demos.

data.title: LiveWallpaper and Daydream: added support for Net.openURI
data.body: Now you can open a browser activity from live wallpaper and daydream applications.

data.title: Added default styles
data.body:
Many people use the default skin for testing scene2d.ui, because it is the only one available AFAIK.

Calling any of the following will result in an exception, because the default skins which are set in the constructors do not exist in the uiskin.json:

`ProgressBar progressBar = new ProgressBar(0, 100, 1, true, skin);`
`ProgressBar progressBar = new ProgressBar(0, 100, 1, false, skin);`
`Slider slider = new Slider(0, 100, 1, true, skin);`

Thus I added some styles for those cases.

data.title: Add mulLeft to matrices
data.body: Closes #1530

data.title: MathUtils: Fixed isEqual() documentation
data.body: This was obviously a copy-paste issue relating to `isZero()`

data.body: Me and @Mobidevelop have found a fix that seems to work ok. Now it's up to you to test.

data.title: Cannot input non-ASCII characters on iOS
data.body:
I could not input Japanese on iOS because "UITextFieldDelegate #shouldChangeCharacters" always return false in "com.badlogic.gdx.backends.iosrobovm.IOSInput".
Maybe it need to change the return value and implement to clear the text of UITextField(for example, in textFieldShouldEndEditing method).

data.title: Latest JsonReader defective
Box2d Impulses are totally different in Android Release Mode
data.body:
I use libGDX and box2D and I found a strange Behavior while Integrating Box2D in my Game (Engine).
I started to implement https://bitbucket.org/dermetfan/libgdx-utils/wiki/Breakable and everything was fine, until i tried the same Game on my Tablet.

Look here:
http://youtu.be/P9ObJFNlF_w

If I have a breakable Object in Desktop Version, it behaves like expected. On Android it seemed to be much more breakable then on the Desktop Version.
So I started to check where this behavior comes from. The strange Thing is, that in Debugging Mode the behavior is like in the Desktop Version. Only in release mode it breaks faster. Using fixed Timesteps. 

I logged the NormalImpulse(or the Sum), by implementing a custom ContactListener, which delegates to the BreakableManager.

In the CallBack of my Breakable Object i log more detailed Information (all Components of the normal Impulse), but only if the Body is destroyed.
Look at Collision NR28:

Desktop:

Normal Impulse: 0.29399997 Collision NR26
Normal Impulse: 0.29400006 Collision NR27
Normal Impulse: 3.79384 Collision NR28
Normal Impulse: 0.29400003 Collision NR29
Normal Impulse: 0.29400003 Collision NR30

Android:

Normal Impulse: 0.29399997 Collision NR26
Normal Impulse: 0.29400006 Collision NR27
Normal Impulse: 54.596504 Collision NR28
NomalImpulse: 3.79384 n0
NomalImpulse: 50.802666 n1
TangentImpulse: -0.93856573 n0
TangentImpulse: 5.5101436E19 n1
Box strained with NormalImpuse: 54.596504 TangetImpulse: 5.5101436E19
Critical Collision destroying Body 20.0
Normal Impulse: 0.29400003 Collision NR29
Normal Impulse: 0.29400003 Collision NR30

As you can see there is a significantly higher Impulse on Android Release Version (NR28). And the Component of N28 is NormalImpulse n1, which is exactly the differnce. NormalImpulse n0 matches the NormalImpulse on Desktop Version. So now i can ignore n1 part, but i guess something is wrong here?

In Debugging Mode everything is fine, like in Desktop Version.
I found some related Issue, which could be a related problem: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/916

Any Ideas to fix?

data.title: Don't require Android SDK in gdx-setup
data.body: I use libgdx at work to create desktop-only apps for simple animations. It would be nice not to have to keep the Android SDK on my work computer just to make gdx-setup happy.

data.title: backend-src in gradle builds?
data.body:
One thing I've noticed since switching to the Gradle-based build system last night (8pm UTC) is that the sources for the following JAR files are missing fromt he project generated by Gradle:

gdx-backend-robovm-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
robovm-rt-0.0.11.jar
gdx-backend-android-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar

Would it be possible to provide these JARs as part of the Gradle build system so I don't have to download them manually when LibGDX reaches 1.0?

data.title: Intersector#intersectRayBoundsFast incorrect
data.body:
Haven't tested it numerically, but Pax Britannica relies on this functionality to do intersectin testing in it's main menu. The last change broke the main menu. I reverted the BoundingBox version to the old code and left the Vector based version as is in the last HEAD. 

We need to have both return the same result eventually :)

data.title: FragmentApplication never disposed
make changes to project structure, want to add jar
data.body:
I want to add my own jar file and export it with the project when building; adding the jar as a library and then checking it off in project structure (intellij IDE) is not possible. I receive an error when trying to apply: `Module "android"
must not contain source root "/home/chris/Projects/mygame-gdx/android/src".
The root already belongs to module "android"`
If I edit the core.iml file directly my changes are wiped when gradle runs. How do I go about adding my own jar to my project? Or in general edit the project structure without gradle clearing away my changes? I tried editing build.gradle but don't know enough to add a local repo to point to my jar and compile (it never seems to find it)

Appreciate any help!

data.title: SpriteBatch.draw() parameter "clockwise" has no effect
data.body:
Using an LwjglApplication I render a TextureRegion to the screen via the SpriteBatch.draw() method, which basically works fine. However, it seems the "clockwise" parameter has no effect when drawing rotated textures.

For example, when I set this rotation value to 15 the texture is drawn slightly rotated to the left (counter-clockwise), regardless of whether the last parameter to the draw() call is true or false.

data.title: iOS: Non-continuous rendering
data.body:
I saw that there are still a few FIXME in the IOSGraphics class, two of them which could already be removed (GL 1.x support and the Configuration flags) and the one about non-continuous rendering, for which I have found an easy solution:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7747742/on-demand-opengl-es-rendering-using-glkit

It seems that setting `resumeOnDidBecomeActive` to false and overriding the `viewWillAppear(boolean)` method with a call to `setPaused(true)` is enough to make the GLKViewController render on demand.

data.title: Better SequenceAction and ParallelAction constructors
Updated the CHANGES (new Payload param)
data.body: I couldn't find a way to add this to https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1666. Thus there's this mini PR now...

data.title: ScrollPane: fixed checks for floating point equality.
data.body: Not even sure if this is a real issue for the specific case, but generally speaking it's safer to compare for equality within some range when calculations are involved.

data.title: Error generating IPA from command line
data.body:
I'm trying to generate my IPA with _$ gradlew ios:generateIPA_ from commandline but I'm receiving this error:

```
    FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

    * What went wrong:
    Execution failed for task ':ios:createIPA'.
    > No @Marshaler found for parameter 3 of @Callback method<org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication: long $cb$beginBackgroundTaskWithExpirationHandler$(org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplication,org.robov    m.objc.Selector,java.lang.Runnable)>
```

I have unpacked the lastest robovm release under Downloads, and I also updated robovm eclipse plugin. All to 0.0.11.

My build.gradle is configurated with roboVMVersion = "0.0.11".

What could be the problem?

Thanks!

data.title: add get window method to IOSApplocation
data.body:
This is necessary for a particular method of showing interstitial ads, it solves an issue (by workaround) I and others are currently encountering using admob bindings in robovm.

I can also see it being useful in other situations.

data.title: Error in wiki
data.body: In the wiki at [this page](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Manual-project-setup#running-the-game-on-android) I think the call of `initialize` is wrong because there is no overload that accepts a boolean.

data.title: Made Payload available on dragstop without target
data.body:
There are some situations in which a drag starts with a payload and the payload is removed from the source (e. g. Inventory). When the dragging does NOT stop over a target, then only `dragStop` is called on the source, but the payload is not supplied anymore and that makes it more difficult to put the payload back to the source.

The additional payload parameter makes this situation much easier to handle.
